comment: Took him his last semester teaching undergrad, one of the best professors at KSU. If youre in school for MKTG, take this guy. Very knowledgeable and his charisma made our Saturday morning class not so Saturday morning. 3 exams & a MKTG plan is all youre graded on, make sure you CHOOSE YOUR TEAM WISELY on the 1st day since the project is tedious
rating_tags: GROUP PROJECTS--Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: There's not many grades in the class and he lectures during each class, he reviews before each test and gives you the answers if you listen. The hardest part is the group project, but if you put in the work you can get an A (my group did). He treats the class like adults instead of like children and extra credit is given randomly if you attend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The most unfair professor that Ive ever had. He is a tough grader on the project and it will ultimately cost you a good grade. He gives extra credit but hardly anyone gets it. Your grade will come down to luck, if he calls on you for extra credit, if your group members are good.

He's very ok. Large chunk of your grade is the semester long group project, which he grades far too harshly for a non-major course. Lectures are boring and tests are middle of the road difficulty wise. Avoid if you don't like political opinions or really un-funny jokes.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof Bass knows what he's talking about. I wouldn't take again because of the Marketing Plan group project that you'll need to write 30+ pages for and present. He grades it way too hard and it's too much work for a non-major class. Other than that, tests are easy and attendance isn't mandatory. Team captains get 5 extra pts on overall grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He's good. He is funny, he has real world experiance, and you will learn something. The essay is graded by his emotions, and he tells you as much, so don't expect to high of a grade. He pretty much gives you the tests, so do good on them and try hard on the paper. It's a bit of work, easy A.

Professor Bass is a real world experienced teacher. He is funny and adds humor to his lessons. He teaches you how to write a marketing plan in the real world, and how to think from a marketing mindset. You have a group project, and you better pick a good group. You also have tests and a final that he gives a detailed test review for.

EHHHH. he's a solid #2 choice as a professor. His lectures are quite boring tbh but don't have to show up everyday.  First test is 100 question second is 50 and the final is 100.  Semester-long group project which if you pick the right teammates... best of luck to you and you choose them on day one so its a hit or miss thing.  3 test, one project.

Good ole Georgie, what should I say about him. If you are easily insulted, don't take him. I have a great sense of humor and he is not funny. You will be left in the dark 90% of the time about what your grades are since he doesn't think grades are important. Expect recruiters to come in every other class and waste your time, too. Don't buy the book

He was a good professor (not great).  Class was lecture based.  I didn't get the book and did just fine.  Got a B and didn't try hard at all.  He writes the test and then creates the study guide and reviews every point the class before the test.  Go to class and you'll do fine.  Group project isn't too difficult if you have a halfway decent group.

I was incredibly surprised to see poor reviews for this professor. I did  not have to take him for lower level courses, but his Pro Sales class is truly amazing. This is a professor that is here to train winners and create jobs in the market place. Is his class easy?  Not really. But it is incredibly rewarding.

What? He's not hard? OK - 3 Test - in which they're ridiculously hard, and final project (here: He'll give you a company, you'll need to contact the company and do a research in person. Then write a FULL Business Plan and Present this in front of your teammates and guess who else??? Yep you got it, the owners of the company.u pass on their review

I am actually quite surprised at the poor reviews that this professor has had on this site but I am here to rectify the situation. No, Professor Bass is not an easy professor but it IS college so I am not sure what the issue is. Other professors are out there and dropping a class is simple. If you want to learn a LOT and laugh too, this is your guy

He is very enthusiastic and excited to teach what he is teaching. He really tries to make students understand what it will be like in the real world. Requires students to write a full mktg plan for real companies and brings in the real client to watch the presentation, very intimidating!

The comments below are from people from my class, and they seem harsh. Nice guy, however, the marketing plan project was one of the most tedious, time consuming projects I have ever done. It felt like a 4000 level mktg class, but I'm not a mktg major! I could barely finish the 100 question tests in time for end of class. Got A, though.

He had students write full marketing plans for his clients-- huge project, for which his expectations were ridiculously high.  My guess is that he gets a "consulting fee" for such marketing plans which conveniently become the "property of the professor".  He picks apart the plan when he grades it & copies the client on the "grading memo". Not cool.

100 questions on test!! 2 Test 1 Final He does not make the test . This was his first class teaching and he just reads from slides . Had a major project which was very time consuming. To pass the test you have to teach yourself. Have to work really really hard for at least a B

This was his first semester teaching and it shows. He used the class in promoting his own advertising business and had students write marketing plans for his customers.  He used any chance he had to talk about himself and his success in being a sales and then read power points from the book. His tests were easy but team project was not.
